docs.title: <attack> What Is This?
docs.text:
Una sencilla colección de las cartas contenidas en Heroes of Might and Magic 3: El Juego de Mesa, que también ofrece explicaciones extra sobre cómo funcionan algunas cartas o interactúan con otras.

De vez en cuando quiero ver lo que hacen algunas cartas, ya sea mientras teorizo sobre qué jugar, o incluso durante el juego, cuando quiero comprobar o hacer referencia a algo. Esta base de datos pretende ofrecer una forma sencilla de encontrar cualquier carta del juego, incluyendo una referencia visual e información adicional cuando sea necesario o aplicable.

docs.title: <defense> Future Plans?
docs.text:
• Añadir explicaciones adicionales a todas las cartas que puedan necesitar alguna
  • Corregir los datos incorrectos (todas las cartas se han incluido a mano, por lo que es posible que algunas contengan erratas u otras imprecisiones).

docs.text: Este proyecto es un proyecto de aficionados, y no es de ningún modo oficial o afiliado con Archon Studio.

docs.title: Magia Aérea
docs.text:
RegularPotenciado

Habilidad

Type Effect <expert> Effect Regular <permanent> +1 <power> for spells from School of Air Magic. When casting <spell> from the School of Air, you can discard this card, then gain +3 <power>. Empowered <permanent> +1 <power> for spells from School of Air Magic.— OR — <instant> When casting <spell> from the School of Air, you can discard this card, then gain +3 <power>. -

docs.title: Notas
docs.text:
• El efecto experto puede jugarse desde la mano o desde el campo. Esto, sin embargo, no suma los dos efectos, y la habilidad se pone en la pila de descartes después de ser jugada.
  • Ver Efecto Permanente

docs.title: Tiro con Arco
docs.text:
RegularPotenciado

Habilidad

Type Effect <expert> Effect Regular <ongoing> During this Combat round, your Ranged units gain +1 <attack> if the target is a non-adjacent unit. <ongoing> Until the end of the next Combat round, your Ranged units gain +1 <initiative> and +1 <attack> if the target is a non-adjacent unit. Empowered <ongoing> Until the end of the next Combat round, all of your Ranged units gain +1 <initiative> and +1 <attack> if the target is a non-adjacent unit. -

docs.title: Notas
docs.text: • Esta habilidad se activa durante cada ataque a distancia de la ronda de Combate, lo que significa que se aplica a ambos ataques de Elfos y Ballesteros.

docs.title: Artillería
docs.text:
RegularPotenciado

Habilidad

Type Effect <expert> Effect Regular <instant> Deal 1 <damage> to an enemy unit with the lowest <initiative>. <instant> When using the Ballista card, resolve its effect against the same target 3 times. Empowered <instant> When using the Ballista card, resolve its effect against the same target 3 times. -

docs.title: Notas
docs.text:
• Si varias unidades enemigas comparten la misma iniciativa (más baja), el jugador puede elegir a cuál de esas unidades debería hacer daño esta habilidad.
  • El efecto experto solo se puede jugar cuando se activa Ballesta, lo que solo puede ocurrir al comienzo de cada ronda de Combate.
  • Sin una Ballesta activa, solo se puede resolver el efecto básico de esta habilidad.
  • En combinación con Los Astrólogos proclaman la semana del Carro de Munición el efecto experto infligirá 3 veces 2 de daño, es decir, 6 de daño en total.

docs.title: Diplomacia
docs.text:
RegularPotenciado

Habilidad

Type Effect <expert> Effect Regular <map_effect> For every Dwelling you have, draw 1 corresponding Neutral Unit card. You can Recruit one of these units if you <pay> its Recruitment cost. <instant> Skip Combat with Neutral Units on a field whose Field Difficulty is equal to your Hero's level. Visit the field. This Hero gains no Experience. Empowered <map_effect> For every Dwelling you have, draw 1 corresponding Neutral Unit card. You can Recruit one of these units if you <pay> its Recruitment cost.— OR — <instant> Skip Combat with any Neutral Units on the same level as your Hero. Claim the given field and resolve its effect. This Hero gains no Experience. -

docs.title: Notas
docs.text:
• Si el jugador ya tiene una vivienda <golden>, roba cartas de ambos mazos Neutrales, el <golden> y el <azure>.
  • Los costes de reclutamiento de las unidades neutrales se encuentran en la ficha de la unidad correspondiente.
  • Para el reclutamiento que ocurre como resultado del uso de esta habilidad, la ficha de reclutamiento no será volteada. Esto significa que esta habilidad puede utilizarse incluso después de que el jugador ya haya reclutado unidades durante esta ronda.
  • 1 Cuando se juega con miniaturas (ej. cuando se juega en el gran campo de batalla), esta habilidad no puede utilizarse para reclutar unidades de una facción controlada por otro jugador, ni para reclutar unidades neutrales que ya estén reclutadas por otro jugador. Si un jugador roba una carta de este tipo, que no puede ser reclutada, deberá robar una carta de reemplazo en su lugar.

docs.title: Ver También
docs.text:
• Lista de Habilidades

  1. Excepciones para modos de juego específicos. Esta explicación no es válida para todos los modos de juego. La variante específica para el modo de juego se menciona en el texto. ↩

Habilidad

Type Effect <expert> Effect Regular <instant> Draw cards from the Spell deck until you find a Basic Spell card. Take it into your hand or discard it. Reshuffle the rest of the cards back to the Spell deck. <instant> Draw cards from the Spell deck until you find an Expert Spell card. Take it into your hand or discard it. Reshuffle the rest of the cards back to the Spell deck. Empowered <instant> Choose one: Basic Spell, Expert Spell, or School of Magic. Then, draw a card from the Spell deck until you find a chosen type of card. Take it into your hand or discard it. Reshuffle the rest of the cards back to the Spell deck. -

docs.title: Inteligencia
docs.text:
RegularPotenciado

Habilidad

Type Effect <expert> Effect Regular <instant> During Combat, before any unit activates, play a Spell card. You can still only play a Spell card during a Combat round. <instant> During Combat, before any unit activates, play a Spell card. This spell does not count toward your spell limit per Combat round. Empowered <instant> At the beginning of the Combat round, play a Spell card.This spell does not count toward your Spell limit per Combat round. -

docs.title: Notas
docs.text:
• Si ambos jugadores están resolviendo cartas con efectos al comienzo del combate (por ejemplo, jugar inteligencia), el atacante (o el jugador con el token de iniciativa) puede resolver primero su carta.
  • Esta habilidad solo se puede jugar al comienzo del combate en sí, no al comienzo de ninguna ronda de combate.

docs.title: Logística
docs.text:
RegularPotenciado

Habilidad

Type Effect <expert> Effect Regular <ongoing> At the end of your turn, move your Hero's model to an adjacent empty field. <instant> Your Hero gains +1 Movement. Empowered <instant> Your Hero gains +1 <movement>. -

docs.title: Notas
docs.text:
• Los campos se consideran vacíos si no pueden proporcionar un efecto o ya no proporcionar un efecto.Esto significa que los campos con cubos negros o los cubos de facción del jugador cuentan como vacíos.
  • El punto de movimiento adicional también se puede otorgar al héroe secundario.
  • El punto de movimiento adicional es el efecto de uso único, no aumenta permanentemente los puntos de movimiento máximos de un héroe.

docs.title: Suerte
docs.text:
RegularPotenciado

Habilidad

Type Effect <expert> Effect Regular <ongoing> You can reroll a Treasure die and a Resource die once during this turn. <ongoing> You can reroll any die once during this turn. Empowered <ongoing> You can reroll any die once during this turn. -

docs.title: Notas
docs.text:
• The expert effect allows to reroll every die that the player rolls during their entire turn. This includes every attack die during all of the fights during their turn.
  • Esta habilidad se puede jugar durante el turno de un enemigo, solo en una pelea, y solo si el héroe del jugador se defiende.Solo se puede jugar durante la activación de una unidad amigable.

docs.title: Misticismo
docs.text:
RegularPotenciado

Habilidad

Type Effect <expert> Effect Regular <instant> Play this card immediately after casting a spell. Instead of discarding the Spell card, take it back into your hand. <instant> Play this card immediately after casting a spell. Instead of discarding the Spell card and all other cards played together with it, take them back to your hand. Empowered <instant> Play this card immediately after casting a spell. Instead of discarding the Spell card and all other cards played together with it, take them back to your hand. -

docs.title: Nigromancia
docs.text:
RegularPotenciado

Habilidad

Type Effect <expert> Effect Regular <map_effect> Play after winning Combat other than Quick Combat. You can Reinforce a <bronze> or <silver> unit of your choice for half the <gold> cost (rounded down). <map_effect> Play after winning Combat other than Quick Combat. You can Reinforce any unit of your choice for half the <gold> cost (rounded down). Empowered <map_effect> Play after winning Combat other than Quick Combat. You can Reinforce any unit of your choice for half the <gold> cost (rounded down). -

docs.title: Notas
docs.text:
• Only the heroes belonging to the Necropolis Faction may play Necromancy.
  • Necromancy may only be used to reinforce units that belong to the Necropolis Faction.
  • El refuerzo de unidades a través de la nigromancia también puede tener lugar cuando el jugador no tiene la ciudadela construida en su ciudad.
  • If a hero that does not belong to the Necropolis Faction should draw it from the Habilidad deck, they may put it into the discard pile and draw another card instead. They may also choose to keep the card, they may, however, not play it.

docs.text:

  • Sorcery may be played to first draw a card. A spell drawn in this way may then be played immediately after being drawn and receive the spell power bonus granted by Sorcery.

docs.title: Adventure
docs.text: Adventure is a Battlefield-only game mode that comes with the Battlefield Expansion.

docs.title: Cartas
docs.text: Adventure mode includes Adventure cards of two types, Combat and Event.

docs.title: Adventure-Event Card
docs.text:
To resolve an Adventure Event card, resolve its effect.

docs.title: Adventure-Combat Card
docs.text:
Each card contains the Battle Reward and the Basic Reward, with the Battle Reward scaling based on which Combat Power (the number in the circle) the player chooses to challenge.

To resolve an Adventure Combat card, do the following:

  • Choose one of the available Combat Powers (the number in the circle) from the card
  • Select 2 of your units, add their <attack> values and roll 2 Attack dice

If your total power is equal or greater than the chosen Combat Power:

  • Take the Battle Reward corresponding to that Combat Power
  • Take the Basic Reward

If your total power is lower than the chosen Combat Power:

  • Take the Basic Reward
  • Put a <paralysis> token on one of your units that took part in this Combat

To get rid of the <paralysis> token, choose the unit for Combat - do not add its <attack> to your power, then remove the <paralysis> token.

Name Battle Reward Basic Reward Crypt 4 ➣ Roll and resolve 1 <treasure>.5 ➣ Roll 2 <treasure> and resolve 1 of them.7 ➣ Roll 3 <treasure> and resolve 1 of them. <experience> <morale_negative> Cyclops Stockpile 6 ➣ Gain 3 <building_materials>.8 ➣ Gain 5 <building_materials> and 1 <valuables>.10 ➣ Gain 8 <building_materials>, 2 <valuables>, and 1 <experience>. <experience> Dragon Utopia 6 ➣ Roll and resolve 1 <resource_die>. Gain 1 <artifact>.10 ➣ Roll and resolve 2 <resource_die>. Gain 1 <artifact>.12 ➣ Roll and resolve 2 <resource_die>. Gain 2 <artifact> and 1 <experience>. <experience> Dwarven Treasury 6 ➣ Gain 5 <gold> or 1 <valuables>.8 ➣ Gain 5 <gold> and 1 <valuables>.11 ➣ Gain 10 <gold>, 3 <valuables>, and 1 <experience>. <experience> Imp Cache 5 ➣ Roll and resolve 1 <resource_die>.7 ➣ Roll and resolve 2 <resource_die>.9 ➣ Roll and resolve 3 <resource_die>. <experience>

docs.title: Combate
docs.text: AI Combat rules are the same, regardless of fighting against Neutral or Enemy AI units.

docs.title: Initiative
docs.text:
Just like non-AI combat, the unit with the highest <initiative> goes first. In case of a tie, the attacking Hero has priority. If both sides have units with the same initiative, they activate in an alternating fashion, so first the attacker, then the defender.

When fighting an AI Hero, every time one of their units activates, draw a card from their AI and resolve the effect in their stead. The strength of the effect depends on the game difficulty.

docs.title: Targeting
docs.text:
The targeting priorities below assume that conditions are checked from the top and the first matching target is then selected.

In case there's more than one valid target, attack the closest one. If there is a tie between equally valid targets, the player chooses which Unit to attack.

docs.title: Movement
docs.text:
AI Heroes have 3 MP ( <movement>), which they spend to perform the following actions in descending priority:

  • If a player's Hero is on the same Tile as the AI, spend all MP to move towards them and attempt to start Combat.
  • If there are any Mines or Settlements that can be flagged, move towards the closest one.
  • Move towards the player's Town.

docs.title: Banda del Embajador
docs.text:
Major Artifact

<map_effect> For every Dwelling you have, draw 1 corresponding Neutral Unit card. You can Recruit one of these units.— OR — <instant> Reroll a die.

Te detienes para ayudar a un diplomático con un eje roto a solucionar su problema. En agradecimiento, te regala una faja con propiedades mágicas que dice que te permitirá, "ayudar a la gente a ver las cosas a tu manera."

docs.title: Alas de Ángel
docs.text:
Relic Artifact

<map_effect> Chosen Hero gains +1 <movement> and can move through any fields without resolving them. The last visited field must be resolved normally.— OR — <instant> Draw a card.

Sin querer saber realmente donde está el Ángel, a cuyas alas pertecenen, es decir, tomas las alas y te vas rápidamente.

docs.title: Notas
docs.text:
• Después de jugar Alas de Ángel, el Héroe puede moverse a través de las fronteras y los campos bloqueados. Sin embargo, no puede terminar su movimiento en un campo bloqueado.
  • Ver Zona Bloqueada

docs.title: Armadura Portentosa
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

<instant> Roba 1 carta y gana +1 <attack>.— O — <instant> Roba 1 carta y gana +1 <defense>.

Una banda de Bandidos está revisando las posesiones de algunos guerreros muertos. Para ahuyentar a los carroñeros, te das cuenta de que los pícaros habían pasado por alto una coraza sucia, pero útil.

docs.title: Brazos de Legión
docs.text:
Major Artifact

<instant> Reduce the Recruitment or Reinforcement cost of a unit by 5 <gold> - to a minimum of 0.— OR — <instant> Gain 2 <building_materials>.

Registrando una ruina, te sorprende encontrar un trozo de la Estatua de la Legión. La desempolvas con cuidado antes de guardarla en tu mochila.

docs.title: Notas
docs.text:
• Este artefacto solo reduce el costo de reclutamiento, no permite que se realice un reclutamiento adicional.Durante una ronda en la que el jugador ya reclutó unidades (su marcador de población ya está entregado), el efecto de descuento no proporciona ningún beneficio, ya que el jugador ya no puede reclutar.
  • The recruitment discount may be played in combination with cards that allow recruitment (e.g. Nigromancia).
  • Si el jugador recluta fuera de su turno, no se puede usar el efecto de los Brazos de Legión.

Un comerciante Nómada busca protección de una tribu de Goblins. A cambio de tu ayuda, te entrega un par de botas finamente trabajadas. Mirándolas de cerca, ves antiguas tallas grabadas en el cuero.

Visitas a un sabio local y le explicas el motivo de tu viaje. Éste rebusca en un cofre y saca un extraño par de botas que te entrega.

docs.text:

<instant> Play this card before a unit activates. Activate one of your <unit_ranged> units that has not been activated this round.— OR — <instant> Use this after a <unit_ranged> unit's Attack die roll. Ignore 1 Attack die.

You set free an ensnared Unicorn. Snorting and stamping her hoof, she gallops off. Looking down, you see a finely crafted bowstring.

docs.text:
Major Artifact

<instant> Search(2) <spell>.— OR — <instant> +1 <power>, then discard up to 3 cards from your hand to gain +1 <power> per card discarded.

Te encuentras con un herrero que está fundiendo viejas piezas de armadura. Cuando se entera de tu misión, te da una coraza que, según él, se negó a fundir y, por lo tanto, no tiene ningún valor para él.

<instant> +2 <defense> <ongoing> Hasta el final del Combate, esta unidad sufre -1 <attack> (hasta un mínimo de 0).— O — <instant> +1 <defense>

docs.text:
Major Artifact

<instant> Repite cualquier dado.— O — <instant> Coloca un dado de <resource_die> o <treasure> por el lado de tu elección.

Te encuentras con un viajero que te ofrece robar una carta de la extraña baraja. Cuando te niegas, él mismo saca una. Pone cara de sorpresa y desaparece con un chasquido, dejando caer las cartas. Las recoges y te marchas.

docs.title: Colgante de la Dicha Celestial
docs.text:
Relic Artifact

<instant> Discard X cards from hand to gain +X <attack>.— OR — <instant> Remove this card, then gain +4 <attack>.

Tras rescatar a una hechicera de una tumba maldita, ella recompensa tu heroísmo con un exquisito collar de joyas.

docs.text:
Minor Artifact

<instant> Triplica el resultado del dado de Ataque outcome.— O — <instant> +1 <attack>

Ves una pesada hacha clavada profundamente en el suelo. Tras varios intentos infructuosos de tu ejército por extraerla, agarras con fuerza el mango del hacha y tiras de ella sin esfuerzo.

docs.title: Notas
docs.text: • El resultado del dado de Ataque puede triplicarse para otros propósitos que no sean atacar, ej. para jugar el hechizo Infierno. En ese caso, el artefacto también puede ser jugado después de la tirada del dado de Ataque.

docs.title: Amuleto de Maná
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

<instant> Descarta 2 cartas, luego roba 3 cartas.— O — <instant> Roba 2 cartas, luego descarta 1 carta.

Te topas con una caravana de gitanos que están festejando y fortificando sus cuerpos con hidromiel. Te llaman y te dicen: «Si demuestras que sabes bailar el Rama-Buta, te recompensaremos». Tú no lo sabes, pero lo intentas de todos modos. Se ríen histéricamente, pero admiran tu valentía, dándote un extraño encanto.

docs.title: Blasón del Valor
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

<instant> Gana una ficha de <morale_positive>.— O — <map_effect> Ignora el efecto de <morale_negative> de una casilla.

Tras liberar a la princesa de un reino vecino de las garras de unos despreciables esclavistas, ella te otorga un Blasón del Valor.

docs.title: Corona de Dientes de Dragón
docs.text:
Relic Artifact

<instant> Selecciona 2 cartas de Hehizol de tu pila de descarte y devuélvelas a tu mano.— O — <instant> Retira 1 <spell> de tu mano, luego Buscar(2) <spell>.

Tus tropas encuentran una corona. Te la entregan y te fijas en una inscripción. Dice así: "La inteligencia es mejor que la fuerza, y la magia vence a la fuerza. Presta atención a mis palabras y ganarás todos los combates."

Major Artifact

<instant> Select 1 Spell card from your discard pile and put it back into your hand.— OR — <instant> If this Hero is on a Sea tile, you may look at the top 3 cards of your discard pile and take 1 of them into your hand.

Just when you finish setting the camp, hoping to let your legs rest, a critter sneaks up on you and pulls your boot into a hole. Cursing silently, you grope for it. Amazed, instead of the boot, you pull out a crown.

docs.title: Diplomat's Ring
docs.text:

<instant> Reroll any die or any roll.— OR — <map_effect> For every Dwelling you have, draw 1 corresponding Neutral Unit card. You can Recruit one of these units.

  • Eversmoking Ring of Sulfur

docs.title: Anillo de Azufre Inextinguible
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

<permanent> Al inicio de cada ronda de Recursos, gana 1 <valuables>.— O — <instant> Retira esta carta, después gana 2 <valuables>.

You visit an alchemist who, upon seeing your army, is swayed by the righteousness of your cause. The newly loyal subject gives you his eversmoking ring of sulfur to help with the war effort.

docs.title: Ver También
docs.text:
• Capa de Cristal Imperecedero

  • Vial de Mercurio Inacabable

  • Lista de Artefactos

docs.title: Glifo de Gallardía
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

<instant> Gana una ficha de <morale_positive>.— O — <instant> +1 <defense>

Al librar a la campiña del horrible Minotauro que se divertía comiéndose a los Caballeros de los nobles, se te honra con el Glifo de Gallardía.

docs.title: Arco Dorado
docs.text:
Major Artifact

<ongoing> Durante este Combate, tus unidades <unit_ranged> ignoran la penalización de combate.— O — <instant> Una unidad <unit_ranged> de tu elección gana +2 <attack>.

Un encuentro fortuito con un famoso Arquero te lleva a una partida de nudillos desnudos apostando su arco contra tu caballo. Tú ganas.

docs.title: Mangual del Gran Gnoll
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

<instant> +2 <attack> <ongoing> Hasta el final del Combate, esta unidad sufre -1 <defense> (hasta un mínimo de 0).— O — <instant> +1 <attack>

Un torpe Gnoll se ha suicidado con su propio mayal. Conociendo tu superior habilidad con esta arma, retiras con confianza el espectacular mayal de la criatura caída.

docs.title: Cabeza de Legión
docs.text:
Major Artifact

<instant> Reduce el coste de Reclutamiento o Refuerzo de una unidad en 6 <gold> - hasta un mínimo de 0.— O — <instant> Gana 3 <gold>.

Registrando una ruina, te sorprende encontrar un trozo de la Estatua de la Legión. La desempolvas con cuidado antes de guardarla en tu mochila.

docs.title: Ver También
docs.text:
• Arms of Legion
  • Piernas de Legión
  • Escarcela de Legión

  • Torso de Legión

  • Lista de Artefactos

docs.title: Yelmo de la Divina Iluminación
docs.text:
Relic Artifact

<instant> Gana <expert>.— O — <instant> Roba 2 cartas.

Ves un objeto brillante que sobresale del suelo. Envías a un miembro de tu grupo a investigar. Regresa con un yelmo dorado en las manos. Te das cuenta de que debe de ser el Yelmo de la Divina Iluminación, el único yelmo del que se rumorea que está hecho de oro macizo.

docs.title: Ver También
docs.text:
• Celestial Necklace of Bliss
  • Armor of Wonder
  • Sandals of the Saint
  • Sword of Judgement

  • Lion's Shield of Courage

  • Lista de Artefactos

docs.title: Yelmo del Unicornio Alabastrino
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

<instant> Devuelve 1 <spell> de tu elección de tu pila de descartes a tu mano.— O — <instant> Lanza un hechizo de la parte superior de la pila de descartes del mazo <spell> y Elimina esta carta.

Un calderero ambulante que necesita provisiones te ofrece un yelmo con un cuerno de unicornio en la parte superior a cambio de comida y agua. Aceptas y más tarde descubres que el yelmo es mágico.

docs.title: Reloj de Arena de la Hora Aciaga
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

<instant> si el enemigo tiene <morale_positive>, gana <morale_negative>.— O — <instant> Lanza el dado de Ataque. Con un resultado "0", ganas <morale_positive>.

Un giro inesperado en el paisaje te encuentra en medio de una escena espeluznante: buitres hurgando en los despojos de una terrible batalla. Al buscar entre los restos, encuentras un reloj de arena encantado.

docs.title: Carreta de Madera Inagotable
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

<instant> Gain 2 <building_materials>.— OR — <instant> Remove this card, then gain 4 <building_materials>.

Pausing to rest and light a cook fire, you pull wood out of a nearby lumber cart. As you keep pulling wood from the cart, you notice its cargo does not shrink. You realize to your delight that the cart is enchanted, so you take it along.

docs.title: Carreta de Mineral Inagotable
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

<permanent> At the beginning of each Recursos round, gain 1 <building_materials>.— OR — <instant> Remove this card, then gain 3 <building_materials>.

You've found a Goblin weapon smithy making weapons for use against humans. With a tremendous yell you and your army descend upon their camp and drive them away. A search finds a magic card that never runs out of ore.

docs.title: Notas
docs.text:
• El segundo efecto se puede jugar desde la mano o desde el campo.Sin embargo, esto no agrega los dos efectos, y el artefacto se pone en la pila de descarte después de ser jugada.
  • Ver Efecto Permanente

docs.title: Piernas de Legión
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

<instant> Reduce the Recruitment or Reinforcement cost of a unit by 4 <gold> - to a minimum of 0.— OR — <instant> Gain 2 <gold>.

Searching a ruin, you are amazed to find a piece of the Statue of Legion. You carefully dust it off before placing it into your pack.

docs.text:

  • Cabeza de Legión
  • Escarcela de Legión

  • Torso de Legión

  • Lista de Artefactos

docs.title: Escudo de Coraje del León
docs.text:
Relic Artifact

<instant> Discard X cards from hand to gain +X <defense>.— OR — <instant> Remove this card, then gain +4 <defense>.

The Necromancer blasts the Paladin with a fire bolt, bringing him to his knees. You slay the evil one before the final blow. The grateful Paladin gives you the shield that saved him.

docs.text:

  • Celestial Necklace of Bliss
  • Armor of Wonder
  • Sandals of the Saint

docs.title: Escarcela de Legión
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

<instant> Reduce the Recruitment or Reinforcement cost of a unit by 5 <gold> - to a minimum of 0.— OR — <instant> Gain 2 <gold>.

Registrando una ruina, te sorprende encontrar un trozo de la Estatua de la Legión. La desempolvas con cuidado antes de guardarla en tu mochila.

docs.title: Orbe Místico de Maná
docs.text:
Major Artifact

<instant> Search(../4) your discard pile.— OR — <instant> Only if your discard pile is empty. Draw 2 cards.

You come upon a caravan of gypsies who are feasting and fortifying their bodies with mead. They call you forward and say, "If you prove that you can dance the Rama-Buta, we will reward you." You don't know it, but try anyway. They laugh hysterically, but admire your bravery, giving you a strange orb.

docs.title: Collar de Dientes de Dragón
docs.text:
Major Artifact

<instant> +2 <power>.— OR — <ongoing> During this Combat, you can cast 2 <spell> per Combat round.

An old shaman stands in the road before you, screaming something in a language you can't understand. He suddenly vanishes in a cloud of smoke. When the smoke clears, there is a long string of Dragon teeth in the spot where he was standing.

docs.title: Ver También
docs.text:
• Crown of Dragontooth
  • Armadura de Escamas de Dragón
  • Escudo de Escamas de Dragón
  • Tabardo de Ala de Dragón
  • Quiet Eye of the Dragon

  • Lengua Ígnea del Dragón Rojo

  • Lista de Artefactos

docs.title: Colgante de Celeridad
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

<ongoing> During this Combat, the <initiative> of all your <unit_ground> units is increased by 1.— OR — <activation> Move one of your units 1 space.

Visiting a local wise man, you explain the intent of your journey. He reaches into a sack and withdraws a strange necklace which he hands to you.

docs.title: Garrote Ogro de la Ruina
docs.text:
Major Artifact

<instant> Discard 1 card to gain +2 <attack>.— OR — <instant> +1 <attack>

At a roadside tavern, a drunken Ogre challenges you to a fight. Not wanting to hurt the creature, you subdue him, instead. You take his massive club from him to prevent him from getting into any more trouble.

docs.title: Orb of Driving Rain
docs.text:
Major Artifact

<ongoing> When casting a <spell> from the School of Water Magic, double the <power> used for this spell.— OR — <instant> When casting a Water Magic <spell>, Remove this card to gain +5 <power>.

You come across a conjurer who begs to accompany you and your army awhile for safety. You agree, and he offers as payment a strange orb of the elements.

docs.title: Ver También
docs.text:
• Orb of Silt
  • Orb of Tempestuous Fire

  • Orb of the Firmament

docs.title: Orbe de Inhibición
docs.text:
Relic Artifact

<ongoing> During this Combat, all <spell> and Specialty cards deal 0 <damage>. Remove this card instead of discarding it.— OR — <ongoing> During this Combat round, units cannot use their special abilities.

You help a Peasant catch a mare. As gratitude, he hands you a sphere. When you grasp it, you feel the magical energy drain from your limbs...

docs.text:
Major Artifact

docs.title: Orbe de Vulnerabilidad
docs.text:
Relic Artifact

<ongoing> During this Combat, negate all units' special abilities related to <spell>.— OR — <instant> +2 <power>

You meet an old Wizard fiend of yours traveling in the opposite direction. He presents you with a gift: An orb that allows nearby magic resistant creatures to be harmed by magic.

docs.title: Medallón del Coraje
docs.text:
Major Artifact

<instant> Play this card immediately after you perform a Search action and perform that action again.— OR — <instant> Gain 1 <expert>.

Responding to cries for help, you find river Sprites making a sport of dunking an old man. You rescue him and drag the Sprites onto dry land. The Sprites, uncomfortable in the air, give you a magic pendant to let them go.

docs.title: Medallón de la Negatividad
docs.text:
Major Artifact

<instant> Ignore the effect of a spell from the School of Air Magic— OR — <ongoing> Ignore the effect of a spell from the School of Air Magic cast on this unit.

You come upon the remains of a small hut which was clearly destroyed by a very large bolt of lightning. Sifting through the debris, you find an undamaged pendant that seems to tingle in your hand.

docs.title: Medallón de la Segunda Visión
docs.text:
Major Artifact

<ongoing> Selected unit cannot gain <paralysis> during this Combat.— OR — <instant> Remove 1 <paralysis> token.

You come upon a very old woman dying alone. You tend to her final needs and promise a proper burial. Grateful, she gives you a magic pendant emblazoned with a stylized eye. It lets you see with your eyes closed.

docs.title: Plate of the Dying Light
docs.text:
Relic Artifact

<instant> +1 <defense>. This effect can be used to reduce <damage> from <spell>.— OR — <instant> +4 <defense>. This effect can be used to reduce <damage> from <spell>. Then Remove this card.

A brazen goblin with a luxurious armor on his chest questions your power. With a powerful kick in the ass, you prove him wrong.

docs.title: Quiet Eye of the Dragon
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

<ongoing> For this Combat, your selected unit gains +1 <attack>.— OR — <instant> +1 <defense>

While venturing into a decrepit hut you find the skeleton of a long dead witch. Investigation of the remains reveals a ring with a Dragon's eye set into it.

docs.text:

  • Armadura de Escamas de Dragón

docs.title: Capa de las Retractaciones
docs.text:
Major Artifact

<ongoing> During this Combat, no Héroe can use spells with Power "0".— OR — <ongoing> During this Combat, no Héroe can use Spells. Remove this card after Combat.

You discover a young woman fleeing from a hungry bear. You slay the beast in the nick of time, and the grateful Sorceress weaves a magic cloak from the bear's hide.

docs.title: Lengua Ígnea del Dragón Rojo
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

<instant> +1 <defense>— OR — <instant> +1 <attack>

As you are walking along a narrow path, a nearby bush suddenly bursts into flames. Before your very eyes, the flames become the image of a beautiful woman. She holds out a magnificent sword to you.

docs.title: Ver También
docs.text:

docs.title: Tórax
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

<instant> Select 1 Spell card from you discard pile and put it back into your hand. Then, shuffle your discard pile back into your deck of Might and Magic.— OR — <instant> +1 <power>

You trip over, what was, the rib cage of a large creature. Upon further examination, you discover the rib cage to be a piece of armor.

docs.title: Ver También
docs.text:
• Hoja Quebrada del Caballero Muerto
  • Escudo del Muerto Bostezante

  • Skull Helmet

  • Lista de Artefactos

docs.title: Anillo del Caminante
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

<ongoing> For this Combat, your selected unit gains +1 <initiative>.— OR — <instant> At start of Combat with Neutral Units put <paralysis> token on any unit except <azure>.

Visiting a local wise man, you explain the intent of your journey. He reaches into a sack and withdraws a strange ring which he hands to you.

docs.title: Royal Armor of Nix
docs.text:
Major Artifact

<instant> +2 <power>— OR — <map_effect> If this Hero is on a Sea tile, Search(2) <spell>**.

You see a fight on a hill nearby. As you get closer, you see two nix. One is winning, and as he is about to land a finishing blow, you intervene. The defeated nix thanks you for your help, and gifts you with his armor. He believes you deserve it more than he does.

docs.title: Sandalias del Santo
docs.text:
Relic Artifact

<instant> Discard X cards from hand to gain +X <power>.— OR — <instant> Remove this card, then gain +4 <power>.

A Nomad trader seeks protection from a tribe of Goblins. For your assistance, he gives you a finely crafted pair of sandals made from the softest leather. Looking closely, you see fascinating ancient carvings engraved on the leather.

docs.title: Ver También
docs.text:

  • Celestial Necklace of Bliss

  • Lista de Artefactos

docs.title: Escamas del Basilisco Mayor
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

<instant> +3 <spell>— OR — <instant> +1 <spell>, then draw a card.

You meet an old Armero, who claims he owes you a favor. Taking him up on it, he pieces together some Basilisk scales, forming a well-fashioned breastplate.

docs.title: Escudo del Centinela
docs.text:
Relic Artifact

<instant> Discard 1 card to gain +3 <defense>.— OR — <instant> +2 <defense>

You find a large box that seems to be made from some unknown material. When you touch it, the box opens with a load hiss, revealing a gleaming shield within.

docs.title: Grilletes de Guerra
docs.text:
Major Artifact

<instant> If played at the start of Combat, the Enemy Héroe can neither Retreat nor Surrender.— OR — <instant> Draw 2 cards, choose 1 card and discard the other.

Walking through the ruins of an ancient walled city, you find the instrument of the city's destruction, the elaborately crafted Grilletes de Guerra.

docs.title: Shaman's Puppet
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

<ongoing> Choose a unit. Until the end of its activation, for its every attack, the unit rolls 2 dice and resolves the lower result.— OR — <instant> Remove any effect or <paralysis> from the selected unit.

You walked under the ladder and stepped on a black cat. Bad luck follows you, just as that ragged guy. You order to seize him, but he vanishes, leaving a strange doll behind.

docs.title: Shield of Naval Glory
docs.text:
Major Artifact

<instant> +2 <defense>— OR — <map_effect> If this Hero is on a Sea tile, they gain +1 <movement>, and draw 1 card.

You meet an old admiral at the tavern. After a couple of hours full of tales about glorious battles and days long passed he gifts you his parade shield.

docs.title: Escudo de los Condenados
docs.text:
Major Artifact

<instant> Target unit gains +3 <defense> and suffers 1 <damage>. It cannot be used on an enemy unit.— OR — <instant> Target unit gains +5 <defense> and suffers 2 <damage>. It cannot be used on an enemy unit.

A Sprite is carrying a Shield as big as it is. Yuu ask, "Need help?" The Sprite glares at you and answers, "You think this is funny? Fine. You can carry it. I much prefer flying anyway."

docs.title: Escudo de los Señores Enanos
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

<instant> Use this after the Attack die roll. Ignore the Attack die and any additional effects it triggered.— OR — <instant> +1 <defense>

While searching through the rubble of a collapsed mine, you free a group of trapped Dwarves. Grateful, the leader ives you a finely crafted shield.

docs.title: Escudo del Muerto Bostezante
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

<instant> Discard 1 card to gain +2 <defense>.— OR — <instant> +1 <defense>

Your units discover an eerie shrine dedicated to the Undead. You bless the shrine, causing the stone shield emblem, above the altar, to crack. Beneath it, is a real shield, which you decide to remove from this unholy place.

docs.title: Ver También
docs.text:
• Hoja Quebrada del Caballero Muerto
  • Tórax

  • Skull Helmet

  • Lista de Artefactos

docs.title: Yelmo Cráneo
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

<instant> Take 1 non-Artifact card from your discard pile to hand.— OR — <instant> If the enemy has <morale_positive>, they gain <morale_negative>.

A brief stop at an improbable rural inn yields an exchange of money, tales, and accidentally, luggage. You find a magical helm in your new backpack.

docs.title: Ver También
docs.text:
• Hoja Quebrada del Caballero Muerto
  • Tórax

  • Escudo del Muerto Bostezante

  • Lista de Artefactos

docs.title: Espéculo
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

<instant> Discover any Map tile adjacent to the Map tile your Héroe is currently on..— OR — <instant> Remove this card, then draw 1 card.

A merchant from far away lands, trades you a new invention of his people for traveling supplies. It makes distant objects appear closer, and he calls it, a Espéculo.

docs.title: Sombrero del Encantador
docs.text:
Relic Artifact

<instant> Remove 1 card from your hand, then Search(2) the card's deck.— OR — <instant> Remove this card and another one from your hand or discard pile.

You see a Wizard fleeing from a Dragon. He opens a portal and rides through, getting his bat knocked off by the edge of the gate. The Dragon follows, and the gate closes, You pick the hat up.

docs.title: Notas
docs.text:
• With the first effect, only abilities, artifacts, and spells can be exchanged, as only those have a corresponding deck to draw from. Statistics and specialties can not be removed.
  • 1 Con el segundo efecto, cualquier carta puede eliminarse junto con el Sombrero del Encantador.

docs.title: Ver También
docs.text:
• Lista de Artefactos

  1. Not officially confirmed by game designers, and is therefore considered a Community rule. ↩

docs.title: Espíritu de Opresión
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

<ongoing> During this Combat, neither player can use the <morale_positive> token or reroll Attack dice.— OR — <instant> +1 <power>

Walking through the ruins of an ancient walled city, you find the instrument of the city's destruction, the Espíritu de Opresión.

docs.title: Hombreras de Contrapeso
docs.text:
Major Artifact

<instant> Play this card immediately after an enemy casts a <spell>. If it was cast with 1 <power> or less, ignore the <spell> effect.— OR — <instant> Remove this card, then Search(1) <artifact>.

The Necromancer blasts the Paladin with a fire bolt, bringing him to his knees. You slay the evil one before the final blow. The grateful Paladin gives you the cloak that saved him.

docs.title: Espada del fuego infernal
docs.text:
Major Artifact

<instant> +3 <attack>. This unit suffers 1 <damage>. This effect cannot be used on an enemy unit.— OR — <instant> +4 <attack>. This unit suffers 2 <damage>. This effect cannot be used on an enemy unit.

During a sudden storm, a bolt of lightning strikes a tree, splitting it. Inside the tree you find a mysterious sword.

docs.title: Espada del Juicio
docs.text:
Relic Artifact

<instant> Discard X cards from hand to gain +X <attack>.— OR — <instant> Discard X cards from hand to gain +X <defense>.

A Paladin has been mortally wounded by a group of Zombies. He asks you to take his sword and finish what he started. As you pick it up, everything becomes a blur. The Zombies lie dead.

docs.title: Ver También
docs.text:

  • Celestial Necklace of Bliss
  • Armor of Wonder
  • Sandals of the Saint

  • Lion's Shield of Courage

  • Lista de Artefactos

docs.title: Targa del Ogro Enloquecido
docs.text:
Major Artifact

<instant> Discard 2 cards to gain +2 <defense>. Then, instead of discarding, put this card back into your hand.— OR — <instant> +1 <defense>

You come upon a bridge spanning a dry gully. As you begin to cross, a gigantic, maddened Ogre appears from the other side and charges toward you, forcing you to slay it. You decide to take its shield, as a trophy.

docs.title: Thunder Helmet
docs.text:
Relic Artifact

<instant> Select 1 Spell card from your discard pile and put it back into your hand.— OR — <ongoing> For this Combat, whenever you play a Spell card, draw 1 card from your M&M deck. After the Combat, Remove this card.

A glint of golden light catches your eye. Upon further investigation, you find a golden helm hidden under a bush.

docs.title: Coraza del Titán
docs.text:
Relic Artifact

<instant> Discard 1 card to gain +4 <power>.— OR — <instant> +2 <power>.

A Titan stops you and says, "Pay me 5,000 Gold, or I shall slay you where you stand." You refuse. The Titan grabs the sword hanging from his belt, but you duck between his legs. He is so surprised by this maneuver that he trips, falling on his sword and killing himself, instantly. You relieve him of his belongings.

docs.title: Gladius del Titán
docs.text:
Relic Artifact

<instant> Discard 1 card to gain +3 <attack>.— OR — <instant> +2 <attack>

A Titan stops you and says, "Pay me 5,000 Gold, or I shall slay you where you stand." You refuse. The Titan grabs the sword hanging from his belt, but you duck between his legs. He is so surprised by this maneuver that he trips, falling on his sword and killing himself, instantly.

docs.text:
Relic Artifact

<instant> Find the first Air Magic <spell> in the Spell deck. Take the <spell> into your hand or discard it. Then, reshuffle the deck.— OR — <instant> When playing an Air Magic <spell>, resolve its effect without paying the <power> cost.

You come across a conjurer who begs to accompany you and your army awhile for safety. You agree, and he offers as payment a copy of a book of the elements.

docs.text:
Minor Artifact

<instant> Reduce the cost of Recruitment or reduce the cost of Reinforcing a unit by 6 <gold> (to a minimum of 0).— OR — <instant> Gain 1 <valuables> or 2 <building_materials>.

Registrando una ruina, te sorprende encontrar un trozo de la Estatua de la Legión. La desempolvas con cuidado antes de guardarla en tu mochila.

docs.title: Ver También
docs.text:

  • Cabeza de Legión
  • Piernas de Legión

  • Escarcela de Legión

  • Lista de Artefactos

docs.title: Trident of Dominion
docs.text:
Major Artifact

<instant> +2 <attack>— OR — <map_effect> If this Hero is on a Sea tile, draw 2 cards.

After a long search, you finally find a well. However, your soldiers cannot pull the water bucket out. Apparently, it is stuck. You order your banner carrier to go down and fix it. It turns out that a trident was blocking the way.

docs.title: Túnica del Rey Cíclope
docs.text:
Major Artifact

<instant> Draw 1 card and gain +1 <power>.— OR — <instant> +2 <power>

You catch a Cyclops skinny dipping, and as a prank you make off with his clothes. Later, you realize the tunic is magical.

docs.title: Vial de Sangre Vital
docs.text:
Major Artifact

<instant> Remove up to 3 <damage> from one of your units.— OR — <ongoing> For this Combat, your selected unit gains +1 <health_points>.

You find a mystical shrine hidden among the trees. Floating above the altar is a vial said to contain the Blood of Life. You very carefully remove it, taking care not to disturb anything else.

docs.title: Carro de Munición
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Until the next Astrologers round, each Ballista deals +1 <damage>, each First Aid Tent heals +1 <health_points>‍, and each Ammo Cart allows re-rolling 1 Attack die for all ranged units.

Carro de Munición - ¡la mejor máquina!¡Yo!¡Solo yo tengo el poder del infinito!¿Por qué no hay un héroe que se especialice en mi?¡Porque yo mismo debería ser un héroe! ¡Weehee!

docs.title: Notas
docs.text: • Si se usa el efecto experto de Artillería durante esta semana, inflingirá 3 veces 2 de daño, es decir, 6 de daño en total.

docs.title: Ver También
docs.text:
• Lista de Cartas de los Astrólogos
  • Lista de Máquinas de Guerra

docs.title: Lagarto Molesto
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Cada jugador debe barajar todas sus cartas de Artefacto y Hechizo de su mano junto con su mazo y robar el mismo número de cartas de la parte superior de su mazo de Poder y Magia.

¡Eh, Héroe! ¡Héroe! ¡Eh, ¡Héroe! ¡Héroe! ¡Eh!

docs.title: Ver También
docs.text:
• Lista de Artefactos
  • Lista de Cartas de los Astrólogos
  • Lista de Hechizos

docs.title: Semental del Batallón
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Until the next Astrologer's round:Each Hero gains +1 Movement.

"¡Yo, Adrienne, lo hice!"

docs.title: Gran Limpieza
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Cada jugador debe inmediatamente descartar todas las cartas de su mano y robar el mismo número de cartas.

- ¡Es hora de la limpieza de primavera!- Es invierno. Estamos en Eeofol... Claro...

docs.title: Cielo Azul
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Hasta la siguiente ronda de Astrólogos, todos los <spell> de las Escuelas Magia Aérea y Magia Acuática son lanzados con +1 <power>.

Hola Caras de ElementalBienvenidos a las Carreras de EnrothUna celebración, El Cielo Azul nos espera ahí arribaY ahora es el día que nosotros esperábamos

docs.title: Ver También
docs.text:

docs.title: Charlie y su Circo
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

At the beginning of this round and the next one, each player can draw up to 3 cards from any Neutral Units deck(s) and Recruit one of them. The Players must still <pay> the recruitment cost and have the corresponding Dwelling in their Town(s). Shuffle the remaining cards back into their respective deck(s) afterwards.

¡Hola, Héroe! ¿No quieres un globo? Yo, Héroe, soy Charlie, el Payaso Bailarín. Hay orcos, trolls y todo tipo de sorpresas aquí abajo. Y globos también, ¡de todos los colores!

docs.title: Notas
docs.text:
• Las unidades <azure> no pueden ser reclutadas a través de esta carta.
  • 1 Cuando se juega con miniaturas (ej. cuando se juega en el gran campo de batalla), esta habilidad no puede utilizarse para reclutar unidades de una facción controlada por otro jugador, ni para reclutar unidades neutrales que ya estén reclutadas por otro jugador. Si un jugador roba una carta de este tipo, que no puede ser reclutada, deberá robar una carta de reemplazo en su lugar.

docs.title: Ver También
docs.text:
• Lista de Cartas de los Astrólogos
  • Lista de Ciudades
  • Lista de Unidades

  1. Excepciones para modos de juego específicos. Esta explicación no es válida para todos los modos de juego. La variante específica para el modo de juego se menciona en el texto. ↩

docs.title: Crag Hack
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

For the first Combat this round, all <unit_ground> units gain +1 <attack>. The faction controlling Crag Hack can Reinforce Goblins for free once.

Crag! Hack! Taste the flavor of my axe! Even my goblins strike like behemoths...

docs.title: El Mago Loco
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Hasta la siguiente ronda de Astrólogos:La primera carta de Hechizo jugada por cada jugador vuelve a su mano, en vez de ser descartada.

"¡Soy un duendecillo volador! ¡Vuela! Vuela""Disculpe, Sr. Mago, ¿puede ayudarnos? Necesitamos ir a AvLee...""Lo siento, niña, ya no hago esas cosas. ¿Qué tal un abrazo? ¡Esa es la mejor clase de magia que existe!"

docs.title: Gnomo Bailarín
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Each player can Remove a Statistic card from their discard pile or hand to gain 1 Empowered Statistic card of the same type.

Bienvenido al agujero del infierno, se pone peor aquí cada día.Aprende a vivir como una bestia de fuego en el pozo donde jugamos.

docs.title: Ver También
docs.text:
• Lista de Cartas de los Astrólogos
  • Lista de Características

docs.title: Silencio Sepulcral
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Nada cambia.

Hola silencio, mi viejo amigo.He venido a charlar contigo de nuevo.

docs.title: Destruction
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Each player who has a <permanent> card in play must Remove it and take 5 <gold>.

"I am Escaton the Destroyer also called 'Devil's Doom.' It is a doom you have brought on yourselves by failing to eliminate the devil Kreegans from your realms."

docs.title: Disruption
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Starting from the first player, each player (if possible) can freely rotate 1 tile that has no Hero on it.No tile can be rotated more than once.If it is not possible to rotate even 1 tile, ignore this card and draw another one.

"The world doesn't revolve around you.Think of the others too, you fool."

docs.title: Elementals
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

For each Neutral Unit deck except Azure, discard until you find an Elemental. Place each Elemental face up on top of its deck. When the Elemental is defeated in Combat, put it back on top of its deck. Discard the Elements when this card is replaced.

The most powerful of all elements is the element of... surprise!— Tarnum

docs.title: Notas
docs.text: • Any unit with the word "Elementals" in their name counts as an Elementals unit.

docs.title: Exploradores
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Durante esta ronda, los jugadores no roban cartas al comienzo de sus turnos. En su lugar, cada jugador roba cartas de su <hand>. Después, cada uno de ellos puede descartarse de cualquier número de cartas. Por cada 3 cartas descartadas de esta manera, pueden Retirar una carta Característica y reemplazarla por una carta Característica Potenciada del mismo tipo.

"Somos exploradores. Los que se adentran en las regiones desconocidas de la experiencia. Demonios para unos, ángeles para otros."

docs.title: Notas
docs.text: • 1 La Característica eliminada debe proceder de la mano del jugador. Al coger la [Característica] Potenciada(../statistics/index.md), el jugador la añade a su mano.

docs.title: Ver También
docs.text:
• Lista de Cartas de los Astrólogos
  • Lista de Características

  1. Not officially confirmed by game designers, and is therefore considered a Community rule. ↩

docs.title: Duendecillo Elegante
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Each player immediately gains 1 <morale_positive>

Decidí tomar, en mis propias manos, el destino.Esta fue la primera vez para el amor, que hice.Éramos jóvenes, yo era el dueño del momento.Salimos en una cita a Skeleton Transformer.Su corazón está en mi manga, nos conocemos, a fondo.He mirado a través de ella, conozco cada hueso de ella.

docs.title: Conejo Peludo
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Cada jugador tira inmediatamente 1 dado de Tesoro y gana la bonificación obtenida.

Deprisa, deprisa, consigue tus tesoros gratis, ¡cada tesoro es un voto para Conejo Peludo!

docs.title: Cuarenta Ladrones
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Hasta la siguiente ronda de Astrólogos, siempre que un jugador esté a punto de robar una carta de Evento, roba 2 cartas en lugar de 1, elige 1 para resolver, y pone la otra en el fondo del mazo de Evento.

Mientras camino por las tierras de la sombra de la muerteMiro atrás a mis hechos y me doy cuenta de que no queda muchoSerá mejor que tengas cuidado con lo que dices y por donde caminas.O tú y tu ejército podríais quedar cubiertos con la saliva del Dragón Cobrizo.

docs.title: Notas
docs.text: • En un juego sin eventos esta carta se elimina y en su lugar se roba otra carta.

docs.text:

  • Lista de Eventos

docs.title: Castor Amistoso
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

If you draw this card on the first Astrologers' round, discard it and draw another card.Immediately remove all Black cubes from all locations on the map.

"Cuando la Espada de Escarcha toque la Hoja de Armagedón, el tiempo de Enroth dejará de existir entonces.""¿Sabes que en realidad no rima?"

docs.title: Notas
docs.text:
• Sólo se eliminan los cubos negros, los cubos de facción de color permanecen en los campos (ej. minas).
  • Una segunda ficha de grial no puede entrar en juego con esta carta, aunque el campo con el grial volviera a ser visitable.

docs.title: Dragón Dorado
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Al comienzo de la próxima ronda de Recursos, todos los jugadores ganan 5 <gold>.

Oro, oro, oro, da vida a tu amor.Oro, oro, oro, da vida a tu esperanza.Oro, oro, oro, da vida a tu sueño.Oro, oro, oro, da vida a tu alma.

docs.title: Dragón Codicioso
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Al comienzo de la siguiente ronda de Recursos, todos los jugadores ganan 1 <valuables> menos, hasta un mínimo de 0.

Nunca te rías de dragones vivos, ¡Dracon, eres tonto!

docs.title: Brujo Sombrío
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Hasta la siguiente ronda de Astrólogos:La primera carta de Hechizo jugada en el turno de cada jugador obtiene +1 <power>.

¡Contra el poder de Eeofol, no puede haber victoria!

docs.title: Sátiro Genial
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Hasta la siguiente ronda de Astrólogos:Siempre que desencadenes un Combate con cualesquiera Unidades Neutrales, puedes elegir una carta de Unidades Neutrales para descartarla y robar otra carta del mismo nivel en su lugar.

"¿Conoces alguna melodía de AvLee?""Lo siento, no.""Bien, eso es bueno porque probablemente esto no suene a ninguna."

docs.title: Héroe
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Cada jugador puede <pay> 4 <gold> para Retirar una carta Característica de su mano y sustituirla por una carta Característica Potenciada del mismo tipo. Cada jugador puede hacerlo dos veces, pero ambos intercambios deben hacerse en el mismo turno. Una vez que un jugador hace el intercambio, coloca su cubo de facción sobre esta carta para marcar el hecho.

"¡Eres, sin duda, el peor Héroe del que he oído hablar!""Pero has oído hablar de mí".

docs.text:
• Lista de Cartas de los Astrólogos
  • Lista de Características

docs.title: Amigos de Isra
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Each player can immediately Reinforce a unit on the "Few" side at half the cost.

I was all alone, once upon a time.With me, I only had a knife.But now, I have friends.Now, I have friends for live.

docs.text:

docs.title: Judge Dread
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Until the next Astrologers' round, at the start of Combat with Neutral Units, the attacker can discard all of them and draw new Neutral Units.

Today, I am the law! Lower your forks! These peasants... are under... arrest!

docs.title: Mages
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

During this round, using the Spell Book token is free.You can use it even if you do not have a Mage Guild built.

"Did you hear? A local library is being closed, and they are giving spells away for free!""Let me guess, a Phoenix took over and fixed all the staff?"

docs.title: Tortuga Mágica
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Until the next Astrologer's round:Each Héroe suffers -1 Movement.

Men live and die, and the Tortoise Moves. Empires grow and crumble, and the Tortoise Moves. Gods come and go, and still the Tortoise Moves. The Tortoise Moves.

docs.text:
• Lista de Cartas de los Astrólogos
  • Lista de Héroes

docs.title: McGiver
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

At the beginning of the next round, each player can take 1 Máquina de Guerra of their choice from the Máquina de Guerras deck at not cost.

Hi, this is McGiver. We all know how the Máquina de Guerras work, so when you hear the vrrrum, go for it.

docs.title: Notas
docs.text: • The war machine will be chosen and taken in the resource round that follows the current astrologers proclaim round.

docs.title: Duende Feliz
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

At the beginning of the next Resource round, all players gain 1 <valuables>.

"I wasn't aware that leprechaun gold vanishes." "How could it be else when you just have taken it from me...?"

docs.title: Multilingual Bron
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Until the next Astrologers' round:Every time you use a unit's special ability that requires a roll, you can reroll it once.

Basilisks are trick beasts. Even though we speak with them in Polish, English, and Basilisk, we rarely see eye to eye. Last time we did, somebody got stoned and use the wrong tongue.

docs.title: Ofensiva
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Until the next Astrologers' round, every card that provides X <defense> provides X <attack> instead.

The best defense is a good offense.

docs.title: Pirates
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Until the next Astrologers' round:Every time you win Combat other than Quick Combat, gain 1 <resource_die>.

There is a rumor among Pirates that an amazing treasure is buried somewhere by the Pirate King.

docs.title: Plano Entre Planos
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Each player can immediately Remove up to 2 cards from their hand or from their discard pile.

Hello? Is anybody right there?

docs.title: Plastic Tray
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Until the next Astrologers' round:Units that take Defense roll no Attack dice to get +1 <defense>.

Hail to the plastic tray that protects our models.

docs.title: Crecimiento Profundo
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Until the next Astrologers' round:Your hand limit is increased by 1.

A horn of plenty spills from your hands into the starved lives of hundreds...

docs.title: Restart
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Until the next Astrologers' round:If you draw this card on the first Astrologer's round, discard it and draw another.Your hand <hand> is reduced by 2 to a minimum of 4.

"Someone whispered '111' to me and disappeared.What could this mean?"

docs.title: Rulebook
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

During this round:When you trigger Combat with Neutral Units, the enemy's strength corresponds to the game difficulty setting one level lower than it actually is. If you difficulty setting is Easy, ignore this card and draw another one.

I remember it was here... somewhere.

docs.title: Santuario
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

During this round, Heroes cannot attack one another.If you are playing a Campaign scenario, ignore this card and draw another one.

"What are we trying to prove? What's the point? There are wounded Seamen out there. We can save them if we stop fighting!"

docs.title: Tierra Quemada
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Until the next Astrologers round, all <spell> from the Earth Magic and Fire Magic Schools are cast at a +1 <power>.

And I miss you, like the scorched earth miss the rain.

docs.text:
• Lista de Cartas de los Astrólogos
  • Lista de Hechizos

docs.title: Sociedad
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Each player gains <morale_negative>.

Some Kreegan has told me: "Hell is other people."

docs.title: Spells
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

When you are about to Search the Spell deck, you can perform Search(4) the Spell deck instead.

Economic Assets. Strength of muscles. Political connections. Magic. Al forms of power are the same. Seving a single purpose: giving its possessor a broader spectrum of choices. Alternative courses of action... inevitably, more of them are wrong.

docs.title: Comadreja Veloz
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Until the next Astrologer's round:Once per turn, each player can reroll a Tesoro die or a Resource die.

You need cool rants for the victory dance.Baboons are never better than weasels.Your opponent reigns king in their mind.They dream to be great as the weasely kind.I am the Swift Weasel!

docs.title: Plaga Terrible
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

All players flip one of their units from the "Pack" to the "Pocos" side, if possible.

All populations are halved.Snap.

  • Lista de Unidades

docs.title: Refuerzos Inesperados
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Each player can immediately search the Neutral Units deck and Recruit 1 chosen unit associated with their faction for free. Each player still needs to have the corresponding dwelling built in their town.

"My Lord, my Lady! We're at your command!"

docs.title: Notas
docs.text: • Las unidades <azure> no pueden ser reclutadas a través de esta carta.

docs.title: Wandering Merchant
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Once during this round, each player can buy a War Machine as if they visited a Trading Post, but with a discount of 3 <gold>.

"Everything is easy as shooting fish in a barrel.All you need is to put fish in a barrel... preferably of a cannon.And, incidentally, I just happen to have one on sale!"

docs.title: Whirlpool
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Until the next Astrologers' round, Whirlpools can be used without cost. Additionally, all Heroes can choose their Whirlpool exit tile instead of making a roll. If there is no Sea tile on the map, ignore this card and draw another one.

People assume that whirlpool is a tunnel, a strict progression from the entrance to the exit, but actually, from a non-linear, non-subjective viewpoint, it's more like a fitful funnel of wibbly-wobbly, whirly-whaley... Stuff.

docs.title: Cuervo Blanco
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Each player immediately rolls 1 Resource die and gains the rolled resources.

"Where do you go, fantastic dream bird?""Eeofol, Deyja, Place Between Planes... Still interested?"

docs.title: Libertinaje Salvaje
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

At the beginning of the next Resource round, all players gain 5 less <gold>.

Sit down, there's a party in the tavern today!We are thirsty again!La la la!We drink for a week of Wild DebaucheryFor seven days now!La la la!

docs.title: Wind
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Until the next Astrologers' round:All Heroes can continue their movement after entering a sea field from a land field. If there is no Sea tile on the map, ignore this card and draw another one.

Economic Assets. Strength of muscles. Political connections. Magic. Al forms of power are the same. Seving a single purpose: giving its possessor a broader spectrum of choices. Alternative courses of action... inevitably, more of them are wrong.

docs.title: Una Subasta Turbia
docs.text:
Evento

Repite 3 veces: Revela la carta superior del mazo de Artefacto. En secreto, cada jugador toma tanto <gold> en su mano como esté dispuesto a pagar por él. A continuación, revela tus apuestas al mismo tiempo. El que tenga la propuesta más alta descarta el <gold> y reclama la carta. Si no hay apuestas o hay un empate, descarte la carta.

En la profundidad de la noche, te encuentras con un campamento abarrotado que rodea un escenario. En él, un hombre corpulento con un bigote retorcido grita vigorosamente, "...y el jarrón va a la hermosa ¡Dama barbuda en la última fila! ¡Ahora contempla este maravilloso objeto por el que derramé lágrimas y sangre! No la mía, por supuesto... El precio de salida es..."

docs.title: Comerciante de Artefactos
docs.text:
Evento

Roba 5 artifactoss. Puedes comprar cualesquiera de ellos o el que esté descubierto en la pila de descarte de Artefacto. Al terminar, entrega el resto de cartas al jugador de la izquierda. El intercambio continuará hasta que la última carta sea comprada o hasta que las cartas lleguen al jugador que las robó. cartas de Artefacto Menor cuestan 3 <gold>, Mayor 5 <gold>, Reliquia 7 <gold>.

En tu viaje, deambulas por el taller de un herrero. Te dan la bienvenida con una alegre sonrisa y presentan sus productos.

docs.title: Cripta
docs.text:
Evento

Cada jugador elige una opción: Gana Moral Negativa. Luego lanza 2 <treasure>. Si alguno de ellos muestra <experience>, no ganas nada. En caso contrario, resuelve un resultado— O —Gana Moral Positiva.— O —Solo para <necro>. Refuerza una de tus <bronze> o <silver> por la mitad del coste.

Te acercas tímidamente a la cripta funeraria de antiguos guerreros. Perturbar la paz de los muertos es un acto sucio y despreciable. Sin embargo, algo de valor puede estar enterrado entre estas antiguas tumbas...

docs.title: Pantano Maldito
docs.text:
Evento

Cada jugador elige una opción: Gana Moral Negativa. Luego tira 2 <treasure> y elige un resultado.— O —Retira uno o más <spell> de tu mano; si retiras al menos 2, Busca (3) del mazo de Artefacto.— O —Descarta tu unidad más barata.— O —Solo para <necro>. Refuerza una de tus <bronze> o <silver> gratis.

En tu viaje, te adentras en un pantano. Sólo al cabo de un rato te das cuenta de la inquietante atmósfera que rodea este lugar y de los ojos que acechan bajo la superficie del agua. Los ojos de los muertos. Tu ejército tiembla de pánico mientras tú reflexionas. ¿Los obligarás a seguir adelante o los protegerás con tu magia?

docs.title: Guarida de Ladrones
docs.text:
Evento

Coge las 2 cartas superiores de un mazo de Unidad Neutral de tu elección. Puedes comprar una de ellas. Luego decide qué hacer con la(s) carta(s) restante(s) - puedes colocarlas en la parte inferior o superior del correspondiente mazo de Unidad Neutral.

Buscando entre la maleza, encuentras la entrada secreta a la Guarida de los Ladrones. Allí dentro, una vieja "conocida" te agarra del brazo y empieza a hablarte de todos los "secretos" que ha aprendido desde vuestro último encuentro.

docs.title: Jardín de Apocalipsis
docs.text:
Evento

Cada jugador elige una opción: Robar 4 cartas de tu pila de descartes o de tu mazo. Luego Retira cualquier número de cartas de Hechizo o Habilidad de tu mano. Por cada dos cartas eliminadas de esta forma, puedes realizar Buscar(2) en el mazo de Hechizo o el mazo de Habilidad. Después, descarta todas las cartas de la mano y roba hasta tu <hand>.— O —Déjalas y no ganes nada.

Junto al camino ves un hermoso jardín lleno de flores en plena floración. Un monje sentado en el centro te invita a meditar con él.

docs.title: Ver También
docs.text:
• Lista de Habilidades
  • Lista de Eventos
  • Lista de Hechizos

docs.title: Biblioteca de Ilustración
docs.text:
Evento

For every player in the game, draw the top two Spell cards and put them face-up within all players' reach. Each player can buy once of these <spell> for 6 <gold> or 2 <valuables>.

In the town you are currently visiting, there is a famous library said to possess a vast collection of arcane tomes. Are you willing to seek their knowledge?

docs.title: Laboratorio de mago
docs.text:
Evento

For every player in the game, draw two Spell cards and place them face-up within all players' reach. Each player can buy one of these <spell> for 4 <gold> or 1 <valuables>. If a player buys a card, they immediately shuffle their deck and discard pile along with the newly bought card.

In the distance, you spot green smoke coming from a lonely tower in the middle of nowhere. When you approach, you are met by a lone mage in a tattered robe sitting by the entrance. Without looking at you, he says: "Tell me what your hea..." The mage hiccups. "...heart desires. And ale... isle... I'll prepare appperfect spell for that..." he gulps from a vial. "...Sooner'rr'laterr."

docs.title: Bosque mágico
docs.text:
Evento

Choose 1 Spell, Artifact, or Habilidad card from your hand and put it face-down on the table.— OR —Draw and view 1 card from the Spell, Artifact, or Habilidad deck and put it face-down on the table.When all players have added a card to the pool, shuffle it. Each player can now either take a card from the pool or gain 4 <gold>.

The sound of music lures you into a magical forest where you see a young person running through the wood. The elusive silhouette disappears whenever you get closer. Finally, you catch up and grab their arm... only to wake up and discover you were unconscious for several hours. Dejected, you rise from the moss with a strange feeling that something has changed.

docs.title: Ver También
docs.text:
• Lista de Habilidades
  • Lista de Artefactos
  • Lista de Eventos
  • Lista de Hechizos

docs.title: Mercado del tiempo
docs.text:
Evento

Each player chooses one option: Discard as many cards as you want, then draw new cards up to your <hand> +2. Remove any number of Habilidad or Spell cards from your hand. For every two cards removed this way, you can perform Search (2) the Artifact deck.— OR —Leave and gain nothing.

In the middle of a small town, you stumble upon a bustling and noisy market. Lured by the cheerful atmosphere, you start walking around. Each item on the display seems weird......after hours of wandering, you find yourself in the middle of the road, not sure when you left the market. When you turn around, you see just an empty road... not even a town in sight. Was all of that just a dream?

docs.title: Ver También
docs.text:
• Lista de Habilidades
  • Lista de Artefactos
  • Lista de Eventos
  • Lista de Hechizos

docs.title: Mercado
docs.text:
Evento

Each player chooses one option: Roll 1 <resource_die> and resolve its effects.— OR —Trade resources using Trading Post rules.— OR —Propose an exchange of resources with other players - one type of resource for one type of resource. Each player can propose one deal.

While passing through a small town, you find a lively marketplace. Despite all the turmoil in the world, this place seems strangely cheerful and happy. Will you stop to see what they offer?

docs.title: Campamento mercenario
docs.text:
Evento

Each player can draw up to 2 Neutral Unit from one of the chosen decks. Then they are spread on the table, and each player can Recruit one of them.

You've come from a camp of mercenaries practicing their combat tactics. They welcome you and your troops and invite you to train with them. Sounds too good to be true...

docs.title: Messenger with Supplies
docs.text:
Evento

Each player draws 2 top cards from the Artifact deck and then chooses one option: Buy one of the cards. Artefacto Menors cards cost 3 <gold>, Major 5 <gold>, Relic 7 <gold>.— OR —Put them both on the Artifact discard pile to roll 2 <resource_die> and resolve one of them.

A lone rider on a battered horse catches up with your army.They dismount, pull out a small package, and stagger toward you.Gasping heavily, the messenger starts:"Your... delivery... arrived..." After that, they faint.You don't remember ordering anything...

docs.title: Mischievous Leprechaun
docs.text:
Evento

Pool 2 <treasure> and 2 <resource_die>, roll them, and put them within all players' reach. Starting from the player who drew this event, each player rolls 1 <treasure> and 1 <resource_die>. If they can match any of the pool's rolls, they may take one matching die from the pool and resolve its effects.

You are making your way through the dense forest when you stumble upon a mischievous magical creature - a leprechaun sitting on a pile of treasures."Answer my question and I shall part with some of these worthless trumpery. Now... what do I have in my pocket?"

docs.title: Prisión
docs.text:
Evento

Draw 2 Neutral Unit cards from any deck (except for Azure). You can buy one of them or discard it to gain 3 <gold>. After that, pass the remaining card to the next player. That player also draws a Neutral Unit card from any deck (except for Azure) and repeats the rest of the process. The exchange goes on till every player has a chance to choose something.

In the town you have passed recently, you heard rumors of some people from your lands having been imprisoned by a local governor. In a dazzling display of daring, you break into the jail and free all imprisoned there. In return, some of them pledge loyalty to your cause.

docs.title: Escuela de Magia y Escuela de Guerra
docs.text:
Evento

Each player chooses one option: Discard as many cards as you want, then draw new cards up to your <hand> +2. Remove any number of Habilidad or Spell cards from your hand. For every two cards removed this way, you can perform Search (2) the Habilidad deck or the Spell deck.— OR —Leave and gain nothing.

On your journey you happen upon two majestic buildings from which two figures emerge - an acolyte whose mere presence fills the air with a tingle of magic and a battle-scarred instructor, grunting between sentences. The both shout at passers-by: "Come and learn the secrets of mystical arts!" "No! Fancy tricks are for the weak. I touch what real warriors need!"

docs.title: Santuario del pensamiento mágico
docs.text:
Evento

For every player in the game, draw two random Spell cards and place them face-up within all players' reach. Each player can either buy one of these <spell> for 6 <gold> or 2 <valuables> or roll and resolve 1 <resource_die>. Place the remaining, not bought, cards in the Spell discard pile.

You come across a lavish shrine attended by a group of high priests. Their eyes are full of fear, and they beg you to chase away nearby monsters. In exchange for protection, they agree to teach you a sophisticated spell.

docs.title: Establos
docs.text:
Evento

Each player chooses one option: Your Main hero gains +1 <movement>.— OR — <pay> 1 <movement> from any of your heroes to roll 1 <resource_die>.

While traveling to your next location, you see a small fork in the road. Out of curiosity, you check it out and find an old stable. The overjoyed host offers you an amazing bargain.

docs.title: La súplica de los aldeanos
docs.text:
Evento

Each player chooses one option: Remove an Artifact or Spell card from your hand.— OR — <pay> 1 <building_materials>— OR — <pay> 5 <gold>— OR — <pay> 1 <movement> from any of your heroes.

In the distance, you see a small village covered in a cloud of smoke. Upon arrival, you are greeted only by charred ruins and the lamentations of families who lost all they had. Will you help them?

  • Lista de Hechizos

docs.title: Ermitaño marchito
docs.text:
Evento

Each player chooses one option: Name a resource that will not show on any of the dice, then roll 3 <resource_die>. If you are correct, resolve one of the dice. If you are wrong, choose one result and subtract it from you resources.— OR —Roll 1 <resource_die>. You may pay the indicated resources to Search(2) the Artifact deck.— OR —Leave and gain nothing.

You've found the humble dwelling of a withered hermit. The hermit tells you that he is willing to give his treasure to the first wise person he meets.

docs.title: Artifact Symbol
docs.text:
Visitable Field

You may Search(2) the Artifact deck.

docs.title: Mercado Negro
docs.text:
Revisitable Field

Look at the top 4 cards from the Artifact discard pile. You may buy one of them for:5 <gold> if it is a Minor Artifact7 <gold> if it is a Major Artifact10 <gold> if it is a Relic Artifact

docs.title: Zona Bloqueada
docs.text: A blocked field is fully enclosed by a thick border and heroes are not allowed to enter it in general.

docs.title: Notas
docs.text:
• Blocked Field cannot be entered, but can be exited.
  • 1 Si a un héroe se le permite entrar en un campo bloqueado debido a un efecto, sólo podrá pasarlo. Esto significa que deben utilizar inmediatamente otro punto de movimiento durante el mismo turno para salir del campo bloqueado. Si no pueden salir del campo, no se les permite entrar en él.
  • 1 Si un héroe necesita retirarse a un campo bloqueado, puede hacerlo, siempre que tenga un punto de movimiento de sobra que pueda utilizar para salir del campo bloqueado durante el mismo turno. Si no le quedan puntos de movimiento, se retira al campo en el que estaba antes de moverse al campo bloqueado.
  • Un héroe no puede terminar su turno en un campo bloqueado.
  • 1 Un campo ocupado por el héroe de un jugador puede ser utilizado por el otro héroe del jugador para pasar a través. Esto significa que el héroe necesita tener otro punto de movimiento disponible después de moverse al campo. Los campos ocupados por los héroes del jugador siguen las mismas reglas que los campos bloqueados.

  • The effect is the same as Temple.

docs.title: Creature Bank
docs.text:
Visitable Field

Please refer to individual Creature Banks for effects.

A Creature Bank is not just a single field, it more of a field type, as there are multiple Creature Banks, each with their own set of guard Units and rewards. They can be either placed on the Far (Ⅱ-Ⅲ) Map tiles or on the Near (Ⅳ-Ⅴ) Map tiles, based on the Roman numerals printed on the back of each Creature Bank token.

docs.title: Combate
docs.text:
P - Player Deployment ZoneN - Guards (Neutral Units) Deployment Zone

When starting Combat at a Creature Bank, the player can place up to 5 of their units in the player deployment zone. Neutral guard units corresponding to the Creature Bank being visited are then placed randomly in the guards deployment zone. There is no round limit for challenging the Creature Bank guards.

docs.title: Difficulty
docs.text:
The game difficulty level affects the units guarding the Creature Bank by distributing Stacked tokens randomly among them. There can only be one token per unit. Each token increased a single statistic of a unit the following way:

  • +1 <attack>
  • +1 <defense>
  • +1 <health_points>
  • +2 <initiative>

Each difficulty increases the amount of tokens distributed. The more Stack units there are, the greater the loot once all the guards are defeated.

Difficulty Tokens Easy 1 Normal 2 Hard 3 Impossible 4

docs.title: Notas
docs.text: • Creature Bank Combat has no field difficulty level, so a Quick Combat is never going to happen at these locations. Additionally, these fields do not provide any <experience>.

Visitable FieldCreature Bank (Ⅱ-Ⅲ)

Units Reward Extra 1x Skeletons1x Zombies1x Wraiths1x Vampires 6 <gold>. 2 <gold> for every Stacked unit.

docs.title: Cyclops Stockpile
docs.text:
Visitable Field

When preparing the Neutral Army guarding this location, instead of drawing 1 <azure> unit, find 2 <golden> Cyclopes and add them to the Neutral Army (look for them first in the <golden> discard pile, and then in the <golden> Neutral Unit deck). If you win the Combat, roll and resolve 4 <resource_die>. Any additional effects depend on the scenario.

docs.title: Dragon Utopia (Creature Bank)
docs.text:

docs.title: Notas
docs.text: • The Dragon Utopia that may be listed in a scenario's description refers to a location on the Center Map tile and is not the same as a Creature Bank Dragon Utopia. In other words, unless explicitly stated otherwise, a Creature Bank Dragon Utopia does not qualify to meet a scenario's Victory Conditions by virtue of being a Dragon Utopia. It may, however, help you meet other types of Victory Conditions, like the ones involving every field on a tile, for instance.

docs.title: Elemental Conflux
docs.text:
Visitable Field

When you enter this location, for every Dwelling you have, draw from the corresponding Neutral Unit deck until you find an "Elementals" card. You can Recruit one of these units if you <pay> its Recruitment cost. Shuffle the rest of the cards back into their decks.

docs.title: Notas
docs.text: • Any unit with the word "Elementals" in their name counts as an Elementals unit.

docs.title: Zona Vacía
docs.text: A field with no effect and no restriction of movement.

docs.title: Notas
docs.text: • Visitable Fields also count as Empty when they have a black cube placed on them (their effect was resolved already).
